page.title: 07Industry
page.content: Del Renfrew packaging occupies a modern factory built by the Development Board on the Dyffryn Industrial estate.It manufactures plastic bottles for holding bubble bath etc.The factory employs 65 people and manufactures 2,0000 bottles every month.The raw materials are mixed at the factory and then passed through an injection mould,where the bottle is formed.The bottles are then printed at the factory using a screen-printing technique.After printing the bottles are passed through a hot air tunnel to dry.They are then packed in boxes placed on a pallet and shrink wrapped with a sheet of plastic.They are removed from the factory by an arcticulated lorry.At the factory there are offices,rest rooms and canteen facilities which are used by the workforce.
